intro: Plectranthus oreophilus, commonly known as the mountain plectranthus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its aromatic, woolly leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or wooded areas and prefers well-drained soil. It is a perennial herb that thrives in moderate climates and is often used in gardens for its ornamental value. Plectranthus oreophilus is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal practices.
